articles.title: Scientists Stunned As Tomatoes “De-Evolve” in the Galapagos - SciTechDaily
articles.description: New research uncovers reversal of evolution in island plants. On the younger, volcanic islands of the Galápagos, wild tomato plants are exhibiting an unusual behavior. They appear to be discarding millions of years of evolutionary changes and reverting to a m…
articles.content: Galápagos tomatoes are reviving ancient, toxic traits in a surprising twist of evolution. Scientists believe this genetic throwback may help them survive the islands’ tough conditions. Credit: Shutte… [+6312 chars]
